item.title: Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist, MAHKOTA – Towards a Strong and Prosperous Indonesian Society
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
MAHKOTA Indonesia – Menuju Masyarakat Indonesia Yang Kokoh Sejahtera (Towards a Strong and Prosperous Indonesian Society) – aims to improve the quality and effectiveness of Indonesia’s poverty reduction programmes. It will support policy reform of existing social protection programmes and help Indonesia better reach and benefit the poorest as well as address key binding constraints to growth, competitiveness and rising inequality through ongoing labour market and social protection reforms. It will foster a wider range of policy debate in the country by supporting national think tanks and support the Indonesian Government in making important reforms towards social security.

Addressing the critical constraints to poverty reduction, economic growth and improved competitiveness goes beyond a single initiative. To reach these outcomes, MAHKOTA will work closely with other Australian development programmes including economic governance, education, health and women’s empowerment.

The Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist will support M&E for individual activities, as well as developing and reporting against the MAHKOTA M&E framework.

Applicants should be able to demonstrate the following:

WORK EXPERIENCE:

  • Minimum 5-7 years of relevant professional experience, including 3 years in a long-term M&E position with an international donor-funded development project/organization;
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in application of the logical framework approach, Performance Monitoring Plan development, and environmental assessment and impact monitoring;
  • Experience working in developing countries is required, preferably in the Asia-Pacific region. Experience of working in Indonesia will be an advantage.

EDUCATION:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Social Sciences (International Development), Business Administration, Economics or other related fields;

SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:

  • Experience in participatory design (outcome mapping, after action review, structured interviews, focus groups, case studies, surveys, and secondary data analysis techniques);
  • Excellent command of survey design, data collection and data management, and data analysis using rigorous statistics and appropriate software;
  • Experience with economic development programs and gender mainstreaming.
  • Ability to explain M&E processes to staff and partners and ensure that they adhere to the highest standards of quality, relevance and timeliness in their M&E efforts;
  • Strong analytical skills and ability to write clear reports;
  • Ability to explain highly technical results to non-technical audiences;
  • Excellent verbal and written English skills.
  • Working knowledge of Bahasa Indonesian an advantage.

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV in DFAT format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting DFAT/AOP/011 MAHKOTA in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

7 Senior Experts: Cluster Leaders/Chairs of Expert Roundtables

They should have a minimum of 10 years' professional experience in development policy broadly speaking (in an NGO, the private sector, or a political institution). Those 10 years should encompass specific experience in the field relevant to the cluster that the expert is chairing. Strong knowledge of EU activities related to that field would be an asset. Proven ability to work under time constraints is important.

Master’s degree in development studies, political science, economics, law, international relations, European Studies or a related area. A PhD would be an advantage.
